query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Inventory of existing value-chain case-studies
result.description: This deliverable will map/catalogue existing cases studies for NM and NM-enabled products, their production, downstream use and waste handling, focusing on those where exposure/release is considered a possibility. Information will be collated from finished and ongoing EU projects and also from literature. Value-chain case studies will be categorized in different levels in line with the rest of the project (e.g., sector covered, environmental compartments affected, applicable existing Tools).

result.title: Report on growth of doped ternary NW materials for pn-junctions.
result.description: This includes the effect of the different dopants (TESn, H2S, CP2Mg and DEZn on the growth dynamics and dopant incorporation if the ternary NW materials (targeted n type degenerate doping of 1x1019 for n and p type GaInP and GaAsP). It will contain an evaluation of the feasibility of using the different dopants and will lead to a choice of dopant for use in the project. The feasibility of using the different dopants in an Esaki diode in combination with the degenerately doped substrate, and in between segments in the NW will be evaluated (Esaki tunneling diode in 1 mm2 cells characterized).

result.title: Initial Infrastructure Software
result.description: Initial Infrastructure Software (Month 18) – The initial release of the infrastructure will be described, this will include an overview over the software architecture, the state of the unified data acquisition framework (T2.1), the data profiling service (T2.2) a description of the “microscopic” level of the recommendation system (T2.3) and first results on automatic recommendations such as the developed visualizations (T2.4). Implementation decisions will be set in relation to the design produced in D1.1. The deliverable will point out the interfacing of the different components within WP2 and, where relevant, to WP3 and project the further work for the final version of the software.

result.description: This deliverable will present the strategies to be used for implementing the solutions integrated in WP3 at the demonstration sites. The efforts undertaken to liaise with the end users while developing these strategies are described. Finally the report includes schedules for the deployment of equipment and the tests planned to be conducted in tasks 4.2, 4.3, 4.4 and 4.5.

result.title: Oilspill risk assessment methodology for extreme conditions, including Arctics
result.description: Deliverable discuss and analyse the probability of accidental spills in different sea areas and environmental conditions. Oil spill sensitivity mapping is important for coastal regions and sensitive sea in terms of the risk profile which changes over time with respect to changes in oil transportation pattern, legal instruments on ship design and operation, and new bunker oil qualities or alternative fuels. A structured overall spill risk assessment model for oil spills in Arctic and sub-arctic conditions is developed to identify response capacity needs, priority areas, and localization of resources.

result.title: Exploitation plan for the (general) REnnovates concept
result.description: Exploitation plan for the (general) REnnovates concept’ this is intended to explore the applicability, commercialization and development of the holistic REnnovates approach in multiple countries – and serves as a summarizing deliverable. The goal is to use the Business Model Tool created in WP1, in line with demonstrator results and identified value in D7.1, D7.2 and D7.3 to get insight in the applicability of the holistic concept in the current, and future legislative- and market frameworks in multiple markets.
